Body:
I used Paho MQTT client in Android to connect to IBM Bluemix quickstart IoT service. The connection part works well, but when I publish, the cloud application displays that I'm disconnected, but in the client I don't get exceptions.

I use this permission:

<uses-permission android:name=android.permission.INTERNET"/>

Connect:

String broker       = "tcp://quickstart.messaging.internetofthings.ibmcloud.com:1883";	String clientId     = "d:quickstart:iotqs-sensor:myDeviceID";		try {	    client = new MqttClient(broker
column10:
null); MqttConnectOptions connOpts = new MqttConnectOptions(); client.connect(connOpts); } catch(MqttException me) {

Publish:

String topic        = "iot-2/evt/iotsensor/fmt/jon";	String content      = "{ \"d\" : { \"data\" : 5 } }";		try {	    MqttMessage message = new MqttMessage(content.getBytes());	    message.setQos(0);	    client.publish(topic
column11:
message); } catch(MqttException me) {

The strange thing is: this code worked yesterday. What could be the problem? The next step will be to connect and publish to my own Bluemix IoT service
column12: but if I can't send messages to the demo
column13:
I can't hope for more.

UPDATE: If I connect
column15: the quickstart app shows that I'm disconnected
column16: but the client still lets me publish for about 3 secs
column17:
after that I get an exception: 32104 (the client is not connected).

"

Body: Did you register your device as iotqs-sensor?  If so, please let me know your org.
No, I just tried to mock the bluemix web simulator, I saw it uses iotqs-sensor. But I registred a device as: type=myDevice, id=myDeviceID, org=ijlqtn

A Device must be registered before it can connect. Refer to quickstart documentation at https://docs.internetofthings.ibmcloud.com/messaging/devices.html#/ I don't see any devices registered under your org. Also
column9:
under the org it shows your email/ID as "expired". Please sign in at https://internetofthings.ibmcloud.com/#/ and add yourself as a permanent user under the access tab.

"

Body: I don't see any device type iotqs-sensor registered to the play organization.
Are you looking for source for a client to connect via quickstart?  You can use the code here for android starter https://github.com/ibm-messaging/iot-starter-for-android
I am not sure the actual quickstart visualization code is available, but there is an iot-visualization sample available on GitHub here:  https://github.com/ibm-messaging/iot-visualization

I found this Playground, where I can register devices:	https://play.internetofthings.ibmcloud.com/dashboard/#/devices/browse		type id= myDeviceType		device id= myDeviceID		organization= play		clientId= d:play:myDeviceType:myDeviceID		https://quickstart.internetofthings.ibmcloud.com/#/device/myDeviceID/sensor/		But this way, I can't connect, not like in the previous version.
Yes, because I changed it to myDeviceType. Thank you for your help, now it's working. Now I try to connect to my own bluemix application. Is the quickstart application source available somewhere?
No (but, thank you for the link), I'm looking for the cloud visualisation part (the graph that show the data from the client). So I can deploy it with my own account and modify/play with it.
